summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2019 between federal prosecutors and support staff regarding the preparation and sending of victim notifications (VNS) in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss verifying victim contact information, coordinating with FBI case agents, correcting errors in the system, and finalizing notification letters ahead of a court conference.

persons.name: Justin
persons.context: Addressee in emails; coordinating victim notification list review with a case agent and scheduling calls to ensure alignment.

persons.name: Daniel J. Rose
persons.context: Identified as counsel for a victim named Edwards; notification letters should be sent to his law firm, Daniel J. Rose, P.A.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Mentioned as also representing a victim, indicating multiple victims had legal representation.

persons.name: Edwards
persons.context: A victim who needed to be added to the victim notification system (VNS).

connections.description: Working together to review the victim notification list and ensure accuracy; planning to meet and talk.
Daniel J. Rose is listed as the attorney representing the victim Edwards.
Brad is identified as also representing a victim (name not specified in the excerpt).

events.title: Coordination call on victim list
events.description: Justin schedules a call for 4 PM to review the current victim notification list with the case agent to ensure alignment.

events.title: Prosecutor out of country
events.description: A prosecutor (likely Justin) is out of the country until Friday, delaying direct coordination on victim notifications.

events.title: Approval to send victim notifications
events.description: Approval is given for victim notification letters to be sent out after updates and verification.

events.title: Court conference scheduled
events.description: Mention of a court conference the following week creates urgency to send out victim notification letters.

keyFacts: Prosecutors and FBI agents were actively working in July-August 2019 to identify, verify contact information for, and formally notify a large volume of victims in the Epstein case.
The Victim Notification System (VNS) was being used, but contained errors like typos in victim names and missing attorney information that needed correction.
Some victims had opted out of notifications, and for others, updated contact information had to be obtained through FBI case agents.
The process involved close coordination between attorneys (Justin), support staff, and FBI case agents, with urgency driven by an upcoming court conference.
